title: Teku fails to collect payload
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `v1.11.1`
CL client & version: teku@23.1.0
OS & Version: Linux
Commit hash : N/A

#### Context
Geth was supposed to produce a block number X

Head was at X-2

07:40:12 - It received request from teku and started working on payload A
07:40:12 - Updated chain head to X+1
07:40:16 - received another request from teku and started working on payload B
07:40:23 - Expected block timestamp for block X
07:40:24 - Stopped working on payload A due to a timeout
07:40:28 - Stopped working on payload B due to a timeout
07:40:40 - Updated chain head to X

#### Expected behaviour
Errors are present in the logs in case block production failed

#### Actual behaviour
Between starting working on a payload to produce a block and failing with a timeout - there are no warning 
Only updates to payload

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Not able to reproduce consistently

#### Backtrace

````
2023-03-07 07:40:00 
INFO [03-07|06:40:00.942] Chain head was updated                   number=16,774,702 hash=182506..c1ecfe root=283c81..17102a elapsed=3.899944ms

INFO [03-07|06:40:12.381] Starting work on payload                 id=0xd3846dc3543749fc

INFO [03-07|06:40:12.451] Updated payload                          id=0xd3846dc3543749fc number=16,774,703 hash=91f794..1d8a91 txs=136  gas=14,644,528 fees=0.02747230685   root=4b72a9..979d5d elapsed=69.557ms

INFO [03-07|06:40:12.643] Imported new potential chain segment     number=16,774,703 hash=eb6dbc..6321d0 blocks=1 txs=129  mgas=14.694 elapsed=84.193ms     mgasps=174.533 dirty=1022.96MiB

2023-03-07 07:40:40 
INFO [03-07|06:40:40.563] Imported new potential chain segment     number=16,774,704 hash=a26341..e5edc8 blocks=1 txs=186  mgas=16.843 elapsed=139.987ms    mgasps=120.315 dirty=1022.46MiB
    
    
2023-03-07 07:40:41 
INFO [03-07|06:40:41.181] Chain head was updated                   number=16,774,704 hash=a26341..e5edc8 root=a49a2a..3bce7a elapsed=3.782237ms
    
    
2023-03-07 07:40:41 
INFO [03-07|06:40:41.297] Imported new potential chain segment     number=16,774,704 hash=a26341..e5edc8 blocks=1 txs=186  mgas=16.843 elapsed=147.741ms    mgasps=114.000 dirty=1022.46MiB
    
    
2023-03-07 07:40:41 
INFO [03-07|06:40:41.834] Chain head was updated                   number=16,774,704 hash=a26341..e5edc8 root=a49a2a..3bce7a elapsed=3.362238ms
    
    
2023-03-07 07:40:48 
ERROR[03-07|06:40:48.380] Failed to build payload                  err="invalid timestamp, parent 1678171235 given 1678171223"
    
    
2023-03-07 07:40:48 
WARN [03-07|06:40:48.380] Served engine_forkchoiceUpdatedV1        conn=10.45.128.78:48040 reqid=266112 duration=16.331186ms err="Invalid payload attributes" errdata="{Error:invalid timestamp, parent 1678171235 given 1678171223}"
````
This "starting the same payload id twice" should not happen, due to this check: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/eth/catalyst/api.go#L355
~~I think this is wrong: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/26115/files#diff-ff0c65eb4c181c607635c50c26108b22539601aae07831788a5f5c741134787cR95~~ nevermind, that's fine

> This "starting the same payload id twice" should not happen, due to this check: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/eth/catalyst/api.go#L355

You're right, those are logs from two geth nodes that work in parallel, teku probably multiplexed the request

> those are logs from two geth nodes that work in parallel

Then I see no error here on part of _geth_: what seems to happen is that teku orders pizza but fails to come pick them up
yes, seems to be the case, thanks for your help
